The Nutanix Certified Professional - Multicloud Infrastructure (NCP-MCI) 6.10 certification is a prestigious credential that validates your expertise in deploying, configuring, managing, and troubleshooting Nutanix multicloud platform environments. As a core component of the Nutanix Multicloud Infrastructure certification track, the NCP-MCI-6.10 exam is designed for IT professionals aiming to demonstrate their proficiency in handling complex cloud infrastructure tasks. Ranked among the top-paying IT certifications, earning the NCP-MCI credential not only enhances your career prospects but also positions you as a leader in the competitive cloud computing job market.

In this article, we’ll explore the NCP-MCI-6.10 exam, its benefits, target audience, and objectives, and introduce the most updated [**NCP-MCI-6.10 exam dumps**](https://www.seekexams.com/exam/ncp-mci-6-10/) from SeekExams, featuring real questions and verified answers to help you pass the exam with confidence.

## Why Pursue the NCP-MCI-6.10 Certification?

The NCP-MCI-6.10 certification signifies that you have the skills and knowledge to effectively manage Nutanix’s hyperconverged infrastructure (HCI) solutions in multicloud environments. With businesses increasingly adopting hybrid and multicloud strategies, certified professionals are in high demand to optimize cloud deployments, ensure security, and minimize downtime. According to industry reports, the NCP-MCI certification is one of the top-paying IT credentials, with certified professionals earning an average annual salary of approximately $175,409 [Udemy, 2025].

[](data:image/png;base64,)

Earning this certification opens doors to advanced career opportunities, validates your technical expertise, and provides tangible benefits, including access to an exclusive community of Nutanix-certified professionals and early access to new educational resources.

## Who Should Take the NCP-MCI-6.10 Exam?

The NCP-MCI-6.10 exam is ideal for IT professionals with:

- 1–2 years of holistic IT infrastructure experience, providing a solid foundation in virtualization, storage, and networking.
- 6–12 months of Nutanix administration experience, ensuring familiarity with Nutanix AOS, Prism Central, and Acropolis Hypervisor (AHV).
- Roles such as administrators, engineers, operators, Tier 1/2 support personnel, or network/security operations engineers who manage Nutanix clusters and cloud integrations.

Many successful candidates enhance their preparation by completing Nutanix training, such as the Enterprise Cloud Administration (ECA) course, available for free through Nutanix University. This course covers critical exam objectives and provides hands-on experience with Nut Nutanix Community Edition (CE), a free platform for practicing cluster management, data protection, and replication.

[](data:image/png;base64,)

## Key Benefits of Earning the NCP-MCI-6.10 Certification

Achieving the NCP-MCI-6.10 certification offers numerous professional and personal rewards, including:

- Exclusive Community Access: Join a global network of Nutanix-certified professionals for collaboration and knowledge sharing.
- Professional Branding: Use the official NCP-MCI logo on your resume, business cards, and LinkedIn profile.
- Digital Badge: Receive a Credly-issued digital badge to showcase your achievement on social media and professional platforms.
- Event Discounts: Enjoy reduced rates for Nutanix events, such as the Nutanix .NEXT conference.
- Early Access to Resources: Gain priority access to new Nutanix educational content and training materials.
    
    [](data:image/png;base64,)
    

These benefits not only enhance your professional credibility but also provide opportunities for career advancement and networking.

## NCP-MCI-6.10 Exam Details

To earn the NCP-MCI-6.10 certification, candidates must pass a proctored exam administered by Pearson VUE, either online or at a testing center. Here are the key details:

- Format: 75 multiple-choice and multiple-response questions
- Time Limit: 120 minutes
- Passing Score: 3000 (on a scaled score range of 1000–6000)
- Languages: English and Japanese
- Price: $199 per attempt
- Delivery: Remote proctoring or at a Pearson VUE testing center

The exam tests your ability to perform key administrative tasks in a Nutanix multicloud environment, covering deployment, configuration, migration, troubleshooting, and management.

[](data:image/png;base64,)

## Comprehensive Exam Objectives and Section Overview

The NCP-MCI-6.10 exam is structured around five key sections, each focusing on critical aspects of Nutanix multicloud infrastructure management:

**Section 1: Manage VMs within a Nutanix Multicloud Environment**

- Create, update, deploy, and migrate virtual machines (VMs).
- Configure VM categories and attributes for efficient management.

**Section 2: Manage Clusters within a Nutanix Multicloud Environment**

- Perform storage and network administration, including Nutanix Distributed File System (NDFS) configuration.
- Configure AOS cluster settings and Prism Central for centralized management.
- Execute firmware and software updates using Life Cycle Manager (LCM).
- Conduct hardware maintenance and configure Intelligent Operations for automation.

**Section 3: Configure Disaster Recovery and Data Protection**

- Set up Protection Policies and Domains for data backup.
- Execute Recovery Plans for failover and disaster recovery.
- Configure Metro Replication for real-time data replication across sites.

**Section 4: Troubleshoot a Nutanix Multicloud Environment**

- Resolve issues related to protection policies, metro replication, and performance.
- Address security and LCM operation challenges in AOS and Prism Central.

**Section 5: Conduct Custom Monitoring**

- Analyze performance charts to optimize infrastructure efficiency.
- Create and review reports for operational insights.
- Perform capacity management analysis to ensure scalability.
    
    [](data:image/png;base64,)
    

These objectives align with Nutanix AOS 6.10 and Prism Central pc2024.2, ensuring candidates are tested on the latest platform features.

[](data:image/png;base64,)

## How to Prepare for the NCP-MCI-6.10 Exam

Effective preparation is key to passing the NCP-MCI-6.10 exam. Here are recommended steps to ensure success:

1. **Leverage Official Nutanix Resources:**
    - Nutanix Cloud Bible: Read sections on Compute, Storage, Networking, and Hybrid Multicloud for foundational knowledge.
    - Official Documentation: Study the AHV Administration Guide, Security Guide, Disaster Recovery Guide, Prism Central Guide, and Prism Web Console Guide.
    - Nutanix University Courses: Enroll in the free Enterprise Cloud Administration (ECA) and Advanced Administration & Performance Management (AAPM) online courses.
        
        [](data:image/png;base64,)
        
2. **Hands-On Practice:**
    - Use Nutanix Community Edition (CE) 2.1 to deploy and manage virtual clusters, practice data protection, and simulate real-world scenarios. CE aligns with AOS 6.8 features, closely matching AOS 6.10.
        
        [](data:image/png;base64,)
        
3. **Study the Blueprint Guide:**
    - The NCP-MCI-6.10 Blueprint Guide outlines exam topics and recommended resources, helping you focus your preparation.

[](data:image/png;base64,)

[](data:image/png;base64,)
